text: What is the fundamental building block of a procedural program?

A class

text: How is a problem typically solved in the procedural paradigm?
options: By modeling real-world objects.
By defining a sequence of steps or procedure calls to follow.
By responding to user-initiated events.
By defining the logical result without specifying the steps.

text: Procedural programming is a sub-paradigm of which broader paradigm?
options: Declarative
Functional
Object-Oriented
Imperative
subject: PROCEDURAL

text: What is a 'top-down design' in the context of procedural programming?
options: Starting with the user interface and working backward.
Breaking a large problem into smaller procedures, then breaking those procedures into even smaller ones.
Writing all the code in a single, long file from top to bottom.
Designing the data structures before writing any functions.
subject: PROCEDURAL
